While I'm very pro clean H2 and believe it will play a significant part in a clean energy future, I'm skeptical about the authors claim that H2 powered vehicles are about to surge.  There is just not the infrastructure (H2 fueling stations) to support it.  Also, the production of clean and/or green H2 is just getting started.  I think it is more likely clean H2 will first find a market in hard to decarbonize sectors, such as:Heavy industry (steel and cement)FertilizerOcean shippingCommercial air travelNew eVTOL air taxies like JOBYNote that while JOBY is starting with a BEV air taxi they plan to extend the range using H2:www.jobyaviation.com/...I do think H2 powered cars and trucks will be an option in the future once the cost of green H2 comes down and fueling stations are common.
